intro: Bupleurum barceloi, commonly known as the Barcelona bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic compounds and often fern-like foliage. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It thrives in rocky or dry habitats and is often found in open woodlands. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
